Description: Light grey limestone statuette of a lion, painted. Lion seated on a small rectangular plinth. The tail is curling around the right hind leg, the front legs are very sturdy. The face is expressive with small, rather narrow, eyes (with traces of black paint); the mouth is slightly open, revealing the teeth with the red painted tongue protruding. The mane is worked flat and appears to be collar-like. There is a break through the frontpaws, belly and hind quarters; ears, head, and chin are chipped.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8
Curator's comments: Faintly marked with a pencil Φ8, ( Aphrodite sanctuary context 8), confirmed by Gardner (Gardner 1888, pl. XIV, no. 6). Parallels from Samos dated 580-570BC (Henke 2013) and 600-575BC (Schmidt 1968 re-dated by Henke 2011) and from Knidos dated c.600-570/560BC (Berges 2006), and known from Rhodian (Pryce B371 ff.), however the execution is much superior. Berges, D. 2006. Knidos, Beiträge zur Geschichte der archaischen Stadt. Zabern. Henke, J-M. 2011. New evidence for the definition of workshops of Cypriot terracottas at East Aegean findspots and its chronological background. Cahiers du Centre d'Études Chypriotes 41.211-222. Schmidt, G. 1968. Samos, VII: Kyprische Bildwerke aus dem Heraion von Samos. Bonn.
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B470)
Nick 2006 / Zypro-ionische Kleinplastik aus Kalkstein und Alabaster (no. 58)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.084) (Phase 3)
